trans-unit.source: Download, install, and register the Azure Backup agent
trans-unit.target: Download, install, and register the Azure Backup agent

trans-unit.source: After creating the Azure Backup vault, an agent should be installed on each of your on-premises servers (Windows Server, Windows client or Data Protection Manager server) that enables back up of data and applications to Azure.
trans-unit.target: After creating the Azure Backup vault, an agent should be installed on each of your on-premises servers (Windows Server, Windows client or Data Protection Manager server) that enables back up of data and applications to Azure.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/)
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Management Portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/)

trans-unit.source: Click **Recovery Services**, then select the backup vault that you want to register with a server.
trans-unit.target: Click **Recovery Services**, then select the backup vault that you want to register with a server.

trans-unit.source: The Quick Start page for that backup vault appears.
trans-unit.target: The Quick Start page for that backup vault appears.

trans-unit.source: Quick start
trans-unit.target: Quick start

trans-unit.source: On the Quick Start page, click the **For Windows Server or System Center Data Protection Manager or Windows client** option under **Download Agent**.
trans-unit.target: On the Quick Start page, click the **For Windows Server or System Center Data Protection Manager or Windows client** option under **Download Agent**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to copy it to the local machine.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to copy it to the local machine.

trans-unit.source: Save agent
trans-unit.target: Save agent

trans-unit.source: Once the agent is installed, double click MARSAgentInstaller.exe to launch the installation of the Azure Backup agent.
trans-unit.target: Once the agent is installed, double click MARSAgentInstaller.exe to launch the installation of the Azure Backup agent.

trans-unit.source: Choose the installation folder and scratch folder required for the agent.
trans-unit.target: Choose the installation folder and scratch folder required for the agent.

trans-unit.source: The cache location specified must have free space which is at least 5% of the backup data.
trans-unit.target: The cache location specified must have free space which is at least 5% of the backup data.

trans-unit.source: If you use a proxy server to connect to the internet, in the **Proxy configuration** screen, enter the proxy server details.
trans-unit.target: If you use a proxy server to connect to the internet, in the **Proxy configuration** screen, enter the proxy server details.

trans-unit.source: If you use an authenticated proxy, enter the user name and password details in this screen.
trans-unit.target: If you use an authenticated proxy, enter the user name and password details in this screen.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Backup agent installs .NET Framework 4.5 and Windows PowerShell (if it’s not available already) to complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Backup agent installs .NET Framework 4.5 and Windows PowerShell (if it’s not available already) to complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: Once the agent is installed, click the **Proceed to Registration** button to continue with the workflow.
trans-unit.target: Once the agent is installed, click the **Proceed to Registration** button to continue with the workflow.

trans-unit.source: Register
trans-unit.target: Register

trans-unit.source: In the vault credentials screen, browse to and select the vault credentials file which was previously downloaded.
trans-unit.target: In the vault credentials screen, browse to and select the vault credentials file which was previously downloaded.

trans-unit.source: Vault credentials
trans-unit.target: Vault credentials

trans-unit.source: The vault credentials file is valid only for 48 hrs (after it’s downloaded from the portal).
trans-unit.target: The vault credentials file is valid only for 48 hrs (after it’s downloaded from the portal).

trans-unit.source: If you encounter any error in this screen (e.g “Vault credentials file provided has expired”), login to the Azure portal and download the vault credentials file again.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter any error in this screen (e.g “Vault credentials file provided has expired”), login to the Azure portal and download the vault credentials file again.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the vault credentials file is available in a location which can be accessed by the setup application.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the vault credentials file is available in a location which can be accessed by the setup application.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter access related errors, copy the vault credentials file to a temporary location in this machine and retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter access related errors, copy the vault credentials file to a temporary location in this machine and retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: If you encounter an invalid vault credential error (e.g “Invalid vault credentials provided") the file is either corrupted or does not have the latest credentials associated with the recovery service.
trans-unit.target: If you encounter an invalid vault credential error (e.g “Invalid vault credentials provided") the file is either corrupted or does not have the latest credentials associated with the recovery service.

trans-unit.source: Retry the operation after downloading a new vault credential file from the portal.
trans-unit.target: Retry the operation after downloading a new vault credential file from the portal.

trans-unit.source: This error is typically seen if the user clicks on the **Download vault credential** option in the Azure portal, in quick succession.
trans-unit.target: This error is typically seen if the user clicks on the **Download vault credential** option in the Azure portal, in quick succession.

trans-unit.source: In this case, only the second vault credential file is valid.
trans-unit.target: In this case, only the second vault credential file is valid.

trans-unit.source: In the **Encryption setting** screen, you can either generate a passphrase or provide a passphrase (minimum of 16 characters).
trans-unit.target: In the **Encryption setting** screen, you can either generate a passphrase or provide a passphrase (minimum of 16 characters).

trans-unit.source: Remember to save the passphrase in a secure location.
trans-unit.target: Remember to save the passphrase in a secure location.

trans-unit.source: Encryption
trans-unit.target: Encryption

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] If the passphrase is lost or forgotten; Microsoft cannot help in recovering the backup data.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] If the passphrase is lost or forgotten; Microsoft cannot help in recovering the backup data.

trans-unit.source: The end user owns the encryption passphrase and Microsoft does not have visibility into the passphrase used by the end user.
trans-unit.target: The end user owns the encryption passphrase and Microsoft does not have visibility into the passphrase used by the end user.

trans-unit.source: Please save the file in a secure location as it is required during a recovery operation.
trans-unit.target: Please save the file in a secure location as it is required during a recovery operation.

trans-unit.source: Once you click the **Finish** button, the machine is registered successfully to the vault and you are now ready to start backing up to Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Once you click the **Finish** button, the machine is registered successfully to the vault and you are now ready to start backing up to Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: When using Microsoft Azure Backup standalone you can modify the settings specified during the registration workflow by clicking on the **Change Properties** option in the Azure Backup mmc snap in.
trans-unit.target: When using Microsoft Azure Backup standalone you can modify the settings specified during the registration workflow by clicking on the **Change Properties** option in the Azure Backup mmc snap in.

trans-unit.source: Change Properties
trans-unit.target: Change Properties

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, when using Data Protection Manager, you can modify the settings specified during the registration workflow by clicking the **Configure** option by selecting **Online** under the **Management** Tab.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, when using Data Protection Manager, you can modify the settings specified during the registration workflow by clicking the **Configure** option by selecting **Online** under the **Management** Tab.

trans-unit.source: Configure Azure Backup
trans-unit.target: Configure Azure Backup
